abstract: As the Boston Red Sox brought the World Series to an abrupt and early end on Sunday, Game 4, like the others in the series, proved to be a boon for Fox, lifting the network to first place in the night’s ratings. Although exact audience figures for the live broadcast were not yet available, Nielsen’s overnight estimates show Fox easily leading every time slot Sunday except the 9 p.m. hour when ABC’s “Desperate Housewives” finished first among adults 18 to 49, drawing 18.1 million total viewers.
lead_paragraph: As the Boston Red Sox brought the World Series to an abrupt and early end on Sunday, Game 4, like the others in the series, proved to be a boon for Fox, lifting the network to first place in the night’s ratings. Although exact audience figures for the live broadcast were not yet available, Nielsen’s overnight estimates show Fox easily leading every time slot Sunday except the 9 p.m. hour when ABC’s “Desperate Housewives” finished first among adults 18 to 49, drawing 18.1 million total viewers.

headline.main: A Sunday Night Home Run for Fox
